image.altText: An SES volunteer in orange overalls walks across grassland towards a row of SES and police vehicles

props.synopsis: Users have reported Facebook's AI search has shown incorrect information about four-year-old Gus who remains missing in SA's outback.

title.children: Expert cautions AI use as it gives misinformation about missing SA boy

image.altText: An empty potato shelf at Woolworths in South Australia.

props.synopsis: South Australia produces 80 per cent of Australia's fresh potatoes, but extreme weather and drought across the state are causing a major shortage.

title.children: Customers face empty shelves as farmers battle potato shortage

image.altText: A smaller Kangaroo stands in front of a larger kangaroo in high grass.

props.synopsis: Farmers are calling for a cull of kangaroos, which they say are being forced onto farmland by drought and dry conditions and consuming what little feed and water they have.

title.children: Kangaroos add pressure on drought-hit farmers by eating scarce feed

image.altText: A vast waterway from above

props.synopsis: The floodwaters which have created an expansive inland oasis on the usually arid salt beds of Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre have reached a peak, and are beginning to evaporate, a local pilot says.

title.children: Floodwaters 'transform whole desert' as Kati Thanda-Lake Eyre reaches peak

image.altText: Clayton Oliver walks off the field with his head down

props.synopsis: Adelaide is no longer in the running for Clayton Oliver, pulling out of the race to sign the Melbourne midfielder after taking some initial due diligence calls. Follow live.

title.children: Oliver race down to two clubs as Adelaide pulls out of trade

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Adelaide pulls out of the race for Clayton Oliver

image.altText: A close up image of an SA Police car.

props.synopsis: A Port Pirie woman has been bailed after police downgraded a murder charge laid over the death of a man to aggravated assault.

title.children: Woman's murder charge downgraded over Port Pirie death

image.altText: Charlie Kirk is stood with a microphone in one hand and a red cap in the other.

props.synopsis: The Australian affiliate of late right-wing activist Charlie Kirk's Turning Point USA is moving into South Australia ahead of next year's state election, but some politicians say the group is "out of step with mainstream values".

title.children: Turning Point Australia moves into SA, ahead of state election

image.altText: A red sign on a bus shelter reading Buy the Best, Buy SA Seafood

props.synopsis: While industry and government tell consumers South Australian seafood is safe, consumer demand is still down amid the algal bloom, with businesses concerned they may not survive.

title.children: Seafood 'good as it's ever been' as sellers fear algal bloom message not getting through

image.altText: Masooma smiles at the camera.

props.synopsis: Masooma came to Adelaide as a refugee from Afghanistan in 2016, and has become the carer of a young girl from a similar cultural background. Experts say it is important carers reflected the diversity of children in care.

title.children: For Afghan refugee Masooma, fostering a child has given her a sense of freedom

image.altText: a man standing out the front of a house holding nrl teams bulldog flags

props.synopsis: Artemios Mintzas, 60, will appear in a Sydney court charged over an alleged shooting spree that shut down an inner-west suburb for about two hours on Sunday night.

title.children: Alleged Croydon Park gunman charged with 25 offences

image.altText: Sussan Ley in press conference

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Sussan Ley raises the case of a trans child abuser as she seeks to pressure the Albanese government to create mandatory minimum jail terms for child exploitation offences.

title.children: Coalition tries to wedge Labor on mandatory child abuse sentencing

image.altText: A woman with brown hair wearing a pink blouse sitting on a couch in a TV studio

props.synopsis: A 24-year-old woman who claims to be Madeleine McCann is on trial charged with stalking the missing child's parents over the past three years.

title.children: Woman claiming to be Madeleine McCann faces court

image.altText: Two US soldiers in fatigues, face covered, sunglasses, crouch on the road, holding a person down, smoke visible in background.

props.synopsis: Illinois is suing to block Donald Trump’s troop deployment to Chicago in what will be the president's fourth legal challenge over federal use of National Guard in cities.

title.children: Illinois sues to stop National Guard in Chicago after court victory

image.altText: A young white man with short brown hair and a blue shirt standing in a Melbourne laneway

props.synopsis: An industry survey finds GPs are managing conditions typically handled by specialists due to high costs and only 12 per cent can afford to bulk-bill all patients.

title.children: GP says fees will go up at his clinic when bulk-billing incentives come in

image.altText: A firefighter carries a hiker out on his back in the dark, with a group of people using head torches.

props.synopsis: Villagers have joined rescue crews in attempting to save those who have become stuck in heavy snow on Mount Everest in Tibet.

title.children: Hundreds of hikers still missing after Mount Everest blizzard

image.altText: Firefighters battling urban bushfire

props.synopsis: New research from Australian researchers shows, globally, major bushfire events are becoming more frequent, fatal and economically damaging.

title.children: Australia's south coast 'very, very high risk' for bushfires, modelling shows

image.altText: A composite image of Megan Fox, Joshua Elmes, Alicia Montebello and Lucus Garzoli

props.synopsis: A coroner determines that the sole survivor of a crash that killed four people at Bochara was behind the wheel during the incident.

title.children: Coroner's warning on crash that killed adult and three teens

image.altText: a man in a dark jacket walks through a brown crop

props.synopsis: We've been spraying it on our farms, gardens and roadsides for 50 years, but the world's most used weedkiller is starting to run out of steam. But after 10 years and hundreds of millions of dollars in R&D, Roundup's owner says it has an alternative.

title.children: German chemical giant to release Roundup alternative in Australia

image.altText: Dozens of birds on the sand next to waves at a beach.

props.synopsis: Wildlife photographer Rob Blakers pleads guilty to trespassing after admitting he camped beyond the boundary line whilst visiting privately owned Robbins Island to observe migratory birds.

title.children: Renowned photographer tried to avoid trespass by staying below high-tide mark

image.altText: A man in a suit holds a press conference with a concerned expression.

props.synopsis: The president's move comes following Sébastien Lecornu's resignation just 14 hours after his appointment, plunging France into another political crisis.

title.children: Macron gives French PM days to save administration after snap resignation

image.altText: A black sausage dog with tan highlights around the muzzle turns its head.

props.synopsis: Valerie's disappearance on South Australia's Kangaroo Island unleashed a 529-day hunt. She dodged rescue attempts and traps and had some wondering whether the sausage dog was mocking them and having the time of her life.

title.children: The psychology of bringing 'mad' sausage dog Valerie in from the wild

image.altText: An aerial shot of a construction site near the ocean's edge, cranes can be seen below.

props.synopsis: It’s taken 10 years, blown out by hundreds of millions of dollars, and is still nowhere near becoming operational. Now there are calls for the Darwin ship lift project to be scrapped.

title.children: Ship lift project dubbed 'one of the biggest blowouts' in Australia

image.altText: An image of an elderly man in a hat playing a guitar.

props.synopsis: Mounted crews and drones are now involved in the search for Peter Willoughby, 76, who became disoriented and walked off into dense bushland near Launceston, police say.

title.children: Second time in a week police have gone to aid of missing 76yo

image.altText: Col Blanch standing in front of a building speaking.

props.synopsis: A radicalisation expert warns a crackdown on gun-owning "sovereign citizens" in West Australia risks further entrenching extremist views in an already disenfranchised group.

title.children: Fears gun raids on sovereign citizens could raise threat level

image.altText: A woman holding an AFP report into the sovereign citizen movement while looking at the Facebook login screen

props.synopsis: A man who says he was threatened after investigating sovereign citizens says the movement should be labelled a terrorist organisation, but an academic argues this could lead to more violence.

title.children: Doxed man petitions to have sovereign citizens declared domestic terrorists

image.altText: Janine Vaughan smiling and wearing a dress.

props.synopsis: With more than 200,000 people expected to attend this weekend's Bathurst 1000, the family of Janine Vaughan wants a billboard raising awareness about her disappearance uncovered.

title.children: Family of missing woman hopes Bathurst 1000 can uncover answers

image.altText: Man stands and looks at camera in a dairy shed.

props.synopsis: Some South Australian farmers say they are still feeling the strain of drought after inconsistent winter rains left little room for recovery before the coming summer.

title.children: South Australian farmers 'on knife edge' ahead of summer after a year of dry conditions

image.altText: A woman sits a court deck.

props.synopsis: Less than a year after the landmark trial which shook the world, Gisèle Pelicot will once again brave a courtroom as one of her rapists appeals his sentence.

title.children: Gisèle Pelicot to face rapist once again in French appeals case

image.altText: Marine scientist Mike Steer.

props.synopsis: The face of South Australia's algal bloom response says the natural event "is not going to ruin summer" and he is looking forward to spending more time with his kids at the beach.

title.children: SA's algal bloom chief keen to hit the beach this summer

image.altText: A sign with a photo of Epstein and Maxwell, urging peole to call if they have been a victim, is pointed to.

props.synopsis: The US Supreme Court declines to hear Ghislaine Maxwell's bid to overturn her conviction for helping the late financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein sexually abuse teenage girls.

title.children: US court declines Ghislaine Maxwell appeal against sex trafficking conviction

image.altText: A PowerPoint showing the three scientists with their faces, biography and a headshot

props.synopsis: The Nobel Prize for Medicine has been given to three scientists for discovering how our immune systems protect us from microbes.

title.children: Trio of scientists win Nobel Prize in Medicine for work on immune system

image.altText: Arlo and Marlin Malpass

props.synopsis: An Australian-first pilot program gets underway in WA in the hope of not only giving the parents of children with complex needs a break, but helping them navigate the maze of different support systems.

title.children: New program allows parents of kids with complex needs to take a break

image.altText: A close-up of Daria Kasatkina looking tired and sweating at Wimbledon.

props.synopsis: Daria Kasatkina ends her 2025 WTA season early, citing the hectic schedule and a high-stress year after switching nationalities to Australia from Russia.

title.children: 'At breaking point': Aussie star Kasatkina joins tennis's 'tap out club'

image.altText: A prison fence and security camera

props.synopsis: Victoria's prison population has surged by 62 per cent in the last 20 years as the number of accused held on remand triples.

title.children: Rise in Victoria's prisoner numbers outpace population growth

image.altText: The supermoon as it rises over Mt Coot-tha in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Our skies will be graced by up to four consecutive supermoons over the next months. Here's why they happen, and how we can end up with multiple supermoons in a row.

title.children: A trifecta of supermoons starts with tonight's harvest moon
